sense.name: a pleasurable diversion, enjoyment
sense.examples: John's main recreation these days is tennis. The students experimented with drugs only as an occasional recreation. These parks are used for recreation such as hiking and canoeing.

sense.name: the reenactment, reproduction or simulation of something
sense.examples: Their recreation of a 17-century German village was very convincing. It is a religious writing that describes cyclic recreations of the universe through eternity. The detective noted inconsistencies in the woman's recreation of the scene of the crime.
